Posts.Content: I've had the same problem, intermittently and less severe, for years. It followed both my vasectomy and, much later, radical prostatectomy. In both cases the original surgeon didn't want to hear about it. As with you, it was probably tissue scarring. I have self-treated using 600-800 mg ibuprofen, ice pack, or cold water to the area with a handheld showerhead (sounds a lot worse than it is).
Posts.Title: Need help for bad groin pain after prostate surgery
